ovdesc.p: All in One Account module enables the Banks to define Account based Loan and Deposit products. The loan/ deposit accounts opened under this module, based on a pre defined All in One Products, are different from the Contract based Loans and Deposits, in view of flexibility in operations, like a normal account. The repayment schedules defined under this module are for the purpose of reference with the account balance, for arriving at the arrears or allowing redraw facilities, on the scheduled dates.
The file AZ.ACCOUNT defines a LOAN or DEPOSIT account opened under a AZ.PRODUCT.PARAMETER.

The ID of a new ACCOUNT opened for this purpose is to be used for opening AZ.ACCOUNT also. The category of the ACCOUNT is defaulted to AZ.ACCOUNT. The category should match with the category defined in the corresponding AZ Product.

The AZ account opened under a particular All In One Product inherits the default features of the product, like penal rate, Repayment type, Maximum Interest only period, etc. However, at AZ account level also, changes are accepted to override the defaulted values.

Certain validations like the minimum term, maximum term, allowed category, maximum back date, minimum and maximum amount (in the case of deposit) are done at the AZ account, with respect to the values defined under the corresponding AZ Product.
From 200607 onwards, History restore functionality if available for AZ Contracts. 'H' function is allowed for reversed, matured & pre-closed contracts
Existing accounts with balance are not to be used to create deposit type AZ contracts.
Notice period in ACCT.GROUP.CONDITION should not be setup for groups in which AZ account category falls.

desc.p: This field is used to decide whether accrued interest has to be paid out or rolled over during rollover of a fixed deposit. Allowed values are YES or NO

If 'YES' is defined, then during rollover, the accrued interest before rollover will be paid out .When final maturity is reached or maturity instruction is Payment to Nominated account, then interest will be paid to Nominated account.

If 'NO' is defined, then interest will be rolled over along with the principal deposit amount by default. The amount of rolled over deposit can anyway be overridden by the rollover amount definition at AZ.ACCOUNT level

In case of user defined annuity contracts with TERM.PRIORITY as 'N', it is possible that even after crossing the original maturity date in the contract , the system needs to further extend the term due to the presence of outstanding balance which is not fully repaid.
In such case when Interest amount happens to be more than total repayment amount, then the system shall raise error irrespective of settings in this field .

If input as 'Y', it is to be understood that change in rate of interest will be applicable not only to the new drawls but also the existing ones.
For the existing drawls, the changed rate will be applicable from the date such change becomes effective.
For ex: Loan draw down is 10.11.2002. Applicable rate is 10%. If effective from 10.06.2003 this rate has been changed to, 14%, then

Defines the basis for calculation of repayment amount for the term of the loan or for recalculation for the remaining term.
Available options are, Principal, Scheduled Balance and Current Balance.
Currently allowed values are,
If 'Principal' is defined, entire Principal amount will be taken into account, for deriving the repayment amount and interest calculations, irrespective of the amount of Principal drawn.
If 'Schedule Balance' is defined, the amount drawn down till date will be taken into account for repayment amount and interest calculation purposes.
If SCHEDULES is set to 'N' then allowed value is 'Principal' else 'Schedule Balance'.
The amount that has to be deducted from or added to the final maturity value of the deposit for further rollover. The amount specified in the field may be LESS, EQUAL or MORE than the deposit.

In case the amount of roll over is more than the deposit amount- the system takes the difference between the deposit amount and the maturity amount from the REPAY account. In case the balance in the repay account is not sufficient to supplement the addition to the deposit - then the account is moved to AZOD category and the exception log is updated i.e. the instruction to rollover the deposit is IGNORED and the AZ is matured.
In case of loans, the difference between principal amount and balance in the loan account is credited to the nominated account.
If the rollover amount is for a value less than the deposit maturity value, then the difference is credited to the Nominated account.

In case of loans, the difference between principal amount and balance in the loan account is debited from repay account. In case balance in the repay account is not sufficient to supplement the addition to the principal amount, then based on PD.LINK.TO.AZ field in APP the oustanding balance amount will be debited. If PD.LINK.TO.AZ is 'YES' then PD will be debited. If PD.LINK.TO.AZ is 'NO' then AZ.OVERDUES will be updated. If PD.LINK.TO.AZ is 'NULL' then FT on hold will be raised.

For reducing the rollover amount, minus sign is to be prefixed with the amount specified under this field. For increasing the rollover amount, the amount by which it is to be increased must be specified under this field.
Example:
Maturity value of a deposit = 100200 If the user wishes to rollover for an amount of 60000, then -40200 is to be entered in this field.
If the user wishes to renew for 150000, then 49800 is to be entered here.
Rule 1: ""-"" sign with amounts to be used in case of decrease in rollover amount. For increase in rollover amount simply the amount need to be mentioned without ""+"" sign.

Defines the method followed by the system, when the derived date of the generated P, B, N and C schedule, is a non working day.
The various methods are:
1. Forward: The system will go forward to the next working day.
2. Backward: The system will go back to the last working day.
3. Fwd Month: The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month, the system will go backward to the last working day.
4. Calendar: The system will use the same date, irrespective of whether it is holiday or not.
This field is not applicable for maturity date.
Valid values are 1 Forward 2 Backward 3 Fwd Month 4 Calendar.

This field indicates the type of schedule defined by the user.
Based on the schedule types defined here, AZ.SCHEDULE is generated by the system.
The types of schedules are:
A - For defining annuity type of repayment, where a constant repayment amount is generated based on the frequency.

It is possible to define multiple 'A' type of schedules within an AZ loan account for different periods during the term of the loan. In such cases, it is necessary to input at least one 'A' type schedule that includes the maturity date and brings the loan balance to zero (or the residual amount).

B - In loans this type is used for effecting loan drawdowns on pre-defined dates. On the specified dates the system will transfer the draw down amount to the credit of the nominated account. It is validated to see that the sum of the amount specified in all B schedules and the Drawdowns made so far, do not exceed the Principal. In deposits this is used to specify the installment deposit credit. If MULTI is defined as 'Y' then each deposit credit will create a sub az.account.

I - Defines schedule for interest payments. For I type schedule, amount cannot be specified by the user. Total period of all I type schedules are validated against the Maximum Interest Only period defined for the AZ account.
N - In loans this schedule specifies the interest repayment by the customer. In deposits it specifies the interest receivable to the customer.
P- This type defines the Repayment of Principal
R - This type is used for effecting Interest Rate revision on specified dates. The value defined under Term Priority will be taken into account for effecting this type of schedule.

Both Variable interest rate and Fixed Interest rate can be defined for a loan account, through this type, for a certain percentage of the outstanding amount and also for various periods within the life of the loan account.
Example:
Type of Schedule: R
Frequency: 20010522
Rate Sch Key: 1
Rate Sch Spread: 6
Rate Sch Operand: Add
Rate Sch Percent: 60
Sch Fixed Rate: 15

As per the above R schedule, a rate revision will happen on 22-05-2001, with 60% of the outstanding amount by a variable interest (key1 and spread 6 on Basic Interest) and 40% of the outstanding amount by fixed interest 15%
For changing the values of interest rates defaulted from the AZ Product to the AZ.ACCOUNT, R type of schedule can be used at the start of the loan account.

C - This is a charge schedule. Incase of CREDIT CARD The charge on individual drawdowns are shown by way of 'C'schedules in the AZ sub a/c and the combined 'C' schedule amount is shown in the schedules of AZ Main a/c.
BC - This is specific to deposits where a charge can be taken if the B schedule is successful. In this case the repayment account is mandatory.

CI - This is specific to CREDIT CARD type of products. This is the committed interest schedule. The amount of interest from the date of draw down to the repayment date is populated through these schedules. Interest on each of the drawdowns is populated in the respective sub a/cs and the combined CI amount is populated in the AZ main a/c. Apart from the draw down date, this schedule is created automatically at every repayment date also covering interest upto the next repayment date.

CC - This is specific to CREDIT CARD type od products. This is for repayment of Principal. Raised, based on the AZ product parameter setup in either revolving ratio/Highest range etc. Similar to CI, C schedules the individual CC schedule amounts are populated in the AZ sub a/cs and the combined CC schedule is populated in the AZ main a/c.
Mandatory field, if the option for SCHEDULE is given as Y

Valid schedule types are A, B, BC, I, IN, N, P, R, Z, C, CC and CI.

Rule 1: Optional field.
This field is used to define the tax code, to be applied on the tax component like Interest.

There are two ways of specifying the tax code here. One way is to enter the code from the TAX file. If any valid code already existing in TAX file is entered here, the relevant information will be picked up from the TAX file, for calculation purposes.

Another way is to specify a valid code from TAX.TYPE.CONDITION file. In this case, the system first reads the CUSTOMER.CHARGE table and then based on the charge group of the customer, picks up the relevant tax record from TAX.TYPE.CONDITION.
To distinguish the code of TAX.TYPE.CONDITION from the TAX file, the code is to be entered by prefixing ' * '.

For example, if ' *VAT' is entered here, it will pick up the relevant code from the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION file. A code entered like '10' (without *), will refer TAX file and pick up the record relating to code 10.
Should have been already defined as a valid record in TAX / TAX.TYPE.CONDITION file.
